column2: The realm's centralization determines how much authority the ruler has in the affairs of its vassals as well as the maximum amount of levies and taxes.
The chaos of the past has caused such decentralisation on the administration of the realm that the only thing holding the realm together is distrust of outsiders and the chains of command.

With the strengthening of administrative prerogatives, the overlord is now able to demand vassals to give up their titles as well as slightly more efficient mustering of men and money from its vassals.

With a moderate amount of control established, the overlord is now able to freely revoke the titles belonging to heretics and heathens as well as relatively effective mustering of men and money from its vassals.
At this level of control, the overlord now reserves the right to demand its vassal cease most of their wars against each other as well as forcing more men and money out of them.
With this level of control, the overlord now enforces the absolute and sole right to war over its rightful vassals, as well as squeezing even more men and money from them.

The level of control the overlord exercises on the realm's diverse clans and tribes determines how a new ruler is chosen, how much authority the overlord has on heads of clans and tribes as well as the maximum amount of levies and tributes he can demand from them. Less control also means the overlord should not control too large a demesne, but the realm can accommodate a larger number of autonomous chieftains.

The overlord has almost no authority on clans and tribes of the realm. Local chieftains think of themselves as almost independent rulers. They recognise their overlord only as a mere primus inter pares, to whom not much more is due than a vague and symbolic allegiance. They expect their overlord to retain a private demesne not larger than theirs.
Minor Control on Clans and Tribes

Enjoying a limited level of authority, the overlord is now able to demand the leaders of clans and tribes to give up their position. Local chieftains may recognize as their obligations to pay a symbolic tribute and to send a few warriors to fight in their liege's wars. They expect their overlord to retain only a limited private demesne.
Moderate Control on Clans and Tribes

With a moderate amount of control established, the overlord is now able to break the authority of heretic and heathen heads of clans and tribes. Local chieftains may recognize as their obligations to pay a limited tribute and to send a fair proportion of their own warriors to fight in their liege's wars.

At this level of control, clans and tribes recognize an institutionalized form of power beyond the immediate oath to their overlord, and they are willing to get actively involved in choosing their next liege. The overlord now reserves the right to demand clans and tribes to cease most of their internal feuding. Local chieftains will recognize as their obligations to pay a significant tribute and to send a large proportion of their warriors to fight in their liege's wars. They acknowledge their overlord's legitimate entitlement to rule directly a large private demesne.

With this level of control, clans and tribes recognize that they belong to an institutionalized State, mirroring the power structure of the great Empire of old, and they are ready to accept similar succession laws. The overlord now enforces the absolute and sole right to engage war over all the realm's clans and tribes. Local chieftains will recognize as their obligations to pay a large tribute and to assembly large hosts to fight in their liege's wars. They acknowledge their overlord's legitimate entitlement to rule directly the realm's lion's share.
The Military Policy of the Crown determines how much men your vassals are obliged to give as well as the efficiency in regrouping the host.
At this level, the provision of levies is mostly dependent on the the whims of the vassals themselves.
At this level, the crown establishes some level of control in the training and recruitment of the levies.
At this level, the Crown establishes better control in recruiting levies and their training.
At this level, the Crown establishes enough regulations to allow even but a few men to be recruited despite their lord's wishes, as well as training the men to reorganize better.
At this level, the Crown asserts its authority enough to recruit a minimum amount of men for most scenarios as well as improved reorganization of the men.
The Economic Policy of the Crown determines how much gold your vassals are obliged to give you as well as the productive efficiency of the realm.
At this level, the Crown is inefficient in imposing taxation upon its vassals.
While still inefficient in taxing its vassals, new policies reduce the severity as well as improving economic productivity for the realm.
At this level. the Crown is able to tax its vassals as is rightfully due, as well as further improving economic productivity..
The Crown's improved policies allows further taxation than usual as well as improving economic productivity even further.
At this level, the Crown is able to maximize taxation that it could legally impose as well as greatly improving economic productivity of the realm.
Noble Emphasis determines the degree by which your feudal vassals contribute either levies or taxes.
Martial Emphasis stresses out maximizing their obligation to send you men in exchange for being mostly exempt from taxation.
Levy Emphasis puts precedence on feudal vassals providing men in lieu of money.
Balanced Emphasis means your feudal vassals attempt to strike a balance in the amount of men they provide you and taxes they contribute.
Taxation Emphasis results in your feudal vassals providing less men than they normally would be obliged to in exchange for providing more taxes than usual.
Mercantile Emphasis further results in your feudal vassals providing even less men than the norm in exchange for providing even more taxes than is regular..
Vassal Demands indicate how strict or relaxed the realm is in enforcing lawful obligations, whether towards the hosts or coffers of the realm..
Lax Demands are when the realm barely obligates its vassals to provide their lawful share, a state which vassals approve of as it means more power retained for them.
Lenient Demands show that the realm is slightly relaxed when collecting men and money from its vassals, which vassals like as they have slightly more power retained for them.
Lawful Demands means the realm requires its vassals to provide exactly what the laws call for, neither more nor less, a fair state of affairs.
Heavy Demands causes the realm to demand its vassals to provide more than what is lawfully asked of them, a state vassals naturally disapprove of.
Harsh Demands makes the realm outright demand their vassals to provide much more than what they are lawfully required to provide, a state of affairs which vassals despise for obvious reasons.
Mercantile Emphasis determines the degree by which your city vassals contribute either soldiers or scutage.
Martial Emphasis stresses out city vassals providing as much soldiery as they can provide in exhange for highly reduced taxation.
Levy Emhasis puts precedence on city vassals providing more levies in exchange for lowered taxes.
Balanced Emphasis means your city vassals attempt to strike a balance in the amount of soldiers they provide you and scutage and taxes to compensate..
Taxation Emphasis results in your city vassals remitting their income from taxation in exchange for providing fewer soldiers.
Mercantile Emphasis furthers the amount of income city vassals have to remit in exchange for being mostly exempted from providing soldiers.
Vassal Demands indicate how strict or relaxed the realm is in enforcing lawful obligations, whether towards the hosts or coffers of the realm..
Lax Demands are when the realm barely obligates its vassals to provide their lawful share, a state which vassals approve of as it means more power retained for them.
Lenient Demands show that the realm is slightly relaxed when collecting men and money from its vassals, which vassals like as they have slightly more power retained for them.
Lawful Demands means the realm requires its vassals to provide exactly what the laws call for, neither more nor less, a fair state of affairs.
Heavy Demands causes the realm to demand its vassals to provide more than what is lawfully asked of them, a state vassals naturally disapprove of.
Harsh Demands makes the realm outright demand their vassals to provide much more than what they are lawfully required to provide, a state of affairs which vassals despise for obvious reasons.
Clergy Emphasis determines the degree the by which your temple vassals contribute either men or money.
Martial Emphasis stresses out maximizing the number of men temple vassals provide the liege in exchange for keeping most of the money for themselves.
Levy Emphasis puts precedence in a larger number of men in exchange for providing less money to the realm..
Balanced Emphasis  means your temple vassals attempt to provide an proportionally equivalent amount of men and money to the realm.
Taxation Emphasis results in your temple vassals providing the host of the realm with fewer men in exchange for reinforcing the coffers of the realm with more money.
Mercantile Emphasis further results in temple vassals prioritising giving money to the realm rather than manpower.

Martial Disposition indicates how much the warrior class of the realm respects the current authority of their high overlord, and with it the amount of their contribution. In particular, it influences the number of soldiers from lower chiefs who will accepting following the overlord in war. Increasing one's authority and good generalship will go far towards improving the warriors' disposition.
The warrior class of the realm hold little respect for their unworthy high overlord, and not only provide far less gold and steel but also fewer eager fighters for the high overlord's host.

The warrior class of the realm find their current high overlord potentially worthy of respect, a level enough to slightly reduce their apprehensions with their high overlord but not eliminate it entirely.

The warrior class of the realm now openly respect the authority of their high overlord, and with it comes their willingness to be more generous in their support of the high overlord's endevours, be it in coin or blood.

The warrior class of the realm have gone beyond mere respect and now openly display loyalty to the cause of their high overlord, flocking not only in greater numbers but also accepting of the high overlord's desire to further increase the policies of the Crown to a certain extent.

The warrior class of the realm are completely enamored and devoted to their high overlord, and willingly offer the high overlord the majority of their power as well as support for any level of increase in the policies of the Crown.

Mercantile Disposition indicates how much the merchant class of the realm respect the current authority of their high overlord, and with it the amount of their contribution. In particular, it influences the volume of taxes cities accept transferring to their overlord. Increasing one's authority and sound management skills will go far towards improving the merchant class's disposition.

The merchant class of the realm hold little respect for their unworthy high overlord, and are neither eager to provide their high overlord only only with a share of their income or men under his host.

The merchant class of the realm find their current high overlord potentially worthy of respect, a level enough to slightly reduce their apprehensions with their high overlord but not eliminate it entirely.

The merchant class of the realm now openly respect the authority of their high overlord, and with it comes their willingness to be more generous in their support of the high overlord's endevours, be it in coin or blood.

The merchant class of the realm have gone beyond mere respect and now openly display loyalty to the cause of their high overlord, not only providing more taxes and urban militia but also accepting of the high overlord's desire to further increase the policies of the Crown to a certain extent.

The merchant class of the realm are completely enamored and devoted to their high overlord, and willingly offer the high overlord the majority of their power as well as support for any level of increase in the policies of the Crown.

Clerical Disposition indicates how much the priest class of the realm respect the current authority of their high overlord, and with it the amount of their contribution. In particular, support of the clerical class is important to provide warriors with a superior cause to risk their lives for their overlord's wars. Increasing one's authority and due respect to the Divine will go far towards improving the priests' disposition.

The priest class of the realm hold little respect for their unworthy high overlord, and with it comes not only fewer soldiers and scutage, but also a marked decrease in the zeal of those who do are forced to fight for the high overlord.

The priest class of the realm find their current high overlord potentially worthy of respect, a level enough to slightly reduce their apprehensions with their high overlord but not eliminate it entirely.

The priest class of the realm now openly respect the authority of their high overlord, and with it comes their willingness to be more generous in their support of the high overlord's endevours, be it in coin or blood or zeal.

The priest class of the realm have gone beyond mere respect and now openly display loyalty to the cause of their high overlord, flocking not only in greater numbers and fervor but also accepting of the high overlord's desire to further increase the policies of the Crown to a certain extent.

The priest class of the realm are completely enamored and devoted to their high overlord, and enthusiastically use their influence over the warriors' souls to the benefit of their overlord. They also support for any level of increase in the policies of the Crown.

column1: #(in case I make the flags into modifiers)

column2: The warrior class of the realm are starting to find interest in your proof of authority, and no longer actively disdain you as before.
The warrior class of the realm now openly respect your authority, and voluntarily contribute their resources to your cause.
The warrior class of the realm now go beyond mere respect to true loyalty, and dedicate themselves and their resources to further your cause.
The warrior class of the realm are now utterly devoted to you, providing you the majority if not the entirety of their power.
The world is ripe for the taking!
The warrior class of the realm have lost the previous interest they had in you, and once again hold you in disdain.
The warrior class class of the realm no longer hold openly respect you, though they still hold some amount of interest in your potential.
The warrior class of the realm no longer hold you in high regard as to swear true loyatly to you as before, but still view you with enough respect and support regardless.
The warrior class of the realm are no longer enamored and blindly devoted to you, but nonetheless still remain loyal and view you in high regard.
